articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 28 people were killed when an airliner went off the runway and slammed into a wall at South Korea's Muan International Airport on Sunday, Yonhap news agency reported.
articles.title: At least 28 dead in fiery aircraft crash in South Korea, Yonhap reports

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Andrew Osborn, Nailia Bagirova
articles.description: The extremely rare publicised apology from Putin was the closest Moscow had come to accepting some blame for Wednesday's disaster, although the Kremlin statement did not say Russia had shot down the plane.
articles.title: Russia's Putin apologises to Azerbaijan over 'tragic' airliner crash

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Maytaal Angel
articles.description: Israeli forces detained dozens of medical staff from a north Gaza hospital they raided on Friday, the enclave's Health Ministry said.
articles.title: Israel detains medics after hospital raid, health officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran, bracing for a possible re-imposition of incoming U.S. president Donald Trump's "maximum pressure" policy, said on Saturday that 2025 would be an important year for its nuclear issue.
articles.title: Iran says 2025 'important year' for nuclear issue

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) said on Saturday it had foiled a plot by Ukraine to kill a high-ranking Russian officer and a pro-Russian war blogger with a bomb hidden in a portable music speaker.
articles.title: Russia says it thwarted Ukrainian plot to kill officer and a blogger

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un held a key policy-setting meeting of the country's ruling party last week ahead of the new year, state media KCNA reported on Sunday.
articles.title: North Korea launches 'toughest' U.S. strategy in key party meeting

articles.author: Nandita Bose
articles.description: President-elect Donald Trump on Saturday sided with key supporter and billionaire tech CEO Elon Musk in a public dispute over the use of the H-1B visa, saying he fully backs the program for foreign tech workers opposed by some of his supporters.
articles.title: Trump sides with Elon Musk in H-1B visa debate, says he's always been in favor of the program

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Finnish authorities said on Saturday they are moving an impounded tanker closer to port after boarding the vessel carrying Russian oil earlier this week on suspicion it had damaged an undersea power line and four telecoms cables.
articles.title: Finland moves tanker suspected of undersea cable damage closer to port

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will go into hospital to have his prostate removed on Sunday after he was diagnosed with a urinary tract infection resulting from a benign prostate enlargement, his office said.
articles.title: Israel's Netanyahu to have prostate removed after diagnosis of benign prostate enlargement

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The newly appointed head of intelligence services in Syria said the country's security institution will be restructured after all current security entities are dissolved, the state news agency reported on Saturday.
articles.title: Syria's head of intelligence says security institution to be restructured
